thread.title: First Dogs: Carly Fiorina sings to terriers in video
thread.title_full: First Dogs: Carly Fiorina sings to terriers in video - CNNPolitics.com

author: Heather Goldin, CNN
title: First Dogs: Carly Fiorina sings to terriers in video
text:
(CNN) Carly Fiorina revisited her singing talents over the weekend, this time in a Facebook video showing her crooning to her Yorkshire terriers, Snickers and Max.
"My name's Snick, and I'm lazy, please don't take a walk with me," Fiorina sings to the tune of "Rock around the Clock."
She originally sang the line on NBC's "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon," after telling the show's host that she likes to sing to her dogs.
In the video, Fiorina's song continues, "I'd rather stay, right here, at home instead I want to lie back down inside in my nice warm bed. My name's Snick and you're gonna have to carry me."
My dog Snickers was made famous on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, but Max was feeling left out.
Posted by Carly Fiorina on Saturday, October 3, 2015 Although Snickers was the center of attention on Fiorina's "Tonight Show" appearance, she tells viewers on Facebook that she also made up a song for her dog Max, but she declines to sing it for now.
Fiorina came away from the second Republican presidential debate with positive reviews , and recent polls show the former Hewlett-Packard CEO in third place behind Donald Trump and Ben Carson.
As of Monday morning the video had 200,000 views, with viewers calling Snickers and Max the "First Dogs of 2016" in the comments.
Follow @CNNpolitics
